channel.title: Comments on: WordPress.com – Comment Replies via Email

item.title: By: Omear
item.dc:creator: Omear
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2008/10/23/wordpresscom-comment-replies-via-email/#comment-2424">Joseph Scott</a>.
my apologies I got you know.
damn that would be sweet if it was able to work for blogs hosted outside of wordpress. Any idea if/when that will happen?
Thanks
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Joseph Scott.

my apologies I got you know.

damn that would be sweet if it was able to work for blogs hosted outside of wordpress. Any idea if/when that will happen?

Thanks

item.title: By: Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2008/10/23/wordpresscom-comment-replies-via-email/#comment-2423">Omear</a>.
Your intranet is hosted by WordPress.com? I'm not talking about downloading the software from WordPress.org, the site has to actually be hosted at WordPress.com. If that's the case <a href="http://josephscott.org/contact/" rel="nofollow">drop me a note</a> with the URL for your blog on WordPress.com and I'll enable it on for your blog.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Omear.

Your intranet is hosted by WordPress.com? I’m not talking about downloading the software from WordPress.org, the site has to actually be hosted at WordPress.com. If that’s the case drop me a note with the URL for your blog on WordPress.com and I’ll enable it on for your blog.

item.title: By: Omear
item.dc:creator: Omear
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2008/10/23/wordpresscom-comment-replies-via-email/#comment-2422">Joseph Scott</a>.
Our intranet is proudly hosted by Wordpress :) (it's a blog lol)
but I don't have that feature.........
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Joseph Scott.

Our intranet is proudly hosted by WordPress ðŸ™‚
(it’s a blog lol)

but I don’t have that feature………

item.title: By: Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2008/10/23/wordpresscom-comment-replies-via-email/#comment-2421">Omear</a>.
This is a feature only for WordPress.com hosted blogs.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Omear.

This is a feature only for WordPress.com hosted blogs.

item.title: By: Omear
item.dc:creator: Omear
item.description:
when is this going live? This is a much needed option for our company intranet and I just found out about this feature last week.
Thank's
item.content:encoded:
when is this going live? This is a much needed option for our company intranet and I just found out about this feature last week.

Thank’s

item.title: By: Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2008/10/23/wordpresscom-comment-replies-via-email/#comment-2419">Jacqueline Lafloufa</a>.
Can you contact WordPress.com support so that we can track that issue in the ticket system.
As for turning it off, there's no need, simply don't reply to comment notification emails.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Jacqueline Lafloufa.

Can you contact WordPress.com support so that we can track that issue in the ticket system.

As for turning it off, there’s no need, simply don’t reply to comment notification emails.

item.title: By: Jacqueline Lafloufa
item.dc:creator: Jacqueline Lafloufa
item.description:
It's interesting, but it doesn't recognize some characters. I write in Portuguese in my blog, so some comments where like Wingdings!
And now, I want to turn off this thing and can't find out how. Could you please help me?
item.content:encoded:
It’s interesting, but it doesn’t recognize some characters. I write in Portuguese in my blog, so some comments where like Wingdings!

And now, I want to turn off this thing and can’t find out how. Could you please help me?

item.title: By: Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott
item.description: We've closed sign-ups for the beta, but we'll eventually be making it active for all blogs.
item.content:encoded: We’ve closed sign-ups for the beta, but we’ll eventually be making it active for all blogs.

item.title: By: susan
item.dc:creator: susan
item.description: How cool is that! I want to try it. Susan
item.content:encoded:
How cool is that! I want to try it.
Susan

item.content:encoded:
